3
OWL and SWRL
What is SWRL? (II) 
SWRL rules describes: 
Body (Antecedente)  Head (Consecuente)
Body and Head are composed by one or more atoms.
If Body is Empty, it implies true.
If Head is Empty, it implies that the Body is false.
Atoms can be: C(x), P(x,y), sameAs(x,y).
Examples:
Person(?p) ^ hasSibling(?p, ?s) ^ Man(?s) -> hasBrother(?p, ?s)
Person(Fred) ^ hasSibling(Fred, ?s) ^ Man(?s) -> hasBrother(Fred, ?s)
speaker: SYSTEM
